ygData.subject: RE: Rumor of the bards ultimate weapon?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... These were the good NPC s I meant...at level 24, I had no hope of actually killing them myself, I know they were high level.  I wasn t really ranting about
ygData.messageBody:
> The Tier'dal Seargents were blue to me at level 40. The
> Tier'dal Lieutenants were red to me, yellow to a L45 friend.
> The named NPCs were red to the L45 friend. If the high level
> people hadn't killed all the "good" NPCs (I assume you mean
> good-potential-loot NPCs), the low level people probably
> would've died a lot more. Of course my server (Karana)
> crashed before the culmination of the event (210 people in
> Kithicor will do that).
>
> What *was* amusing was a lot of the high level folks had the
> "it's blue, kill it" attitude so ingrained that they ended up
> killing NPCs that were on our side. Hope they enjoy the
> faction loss.

These were the good NPC's I meant...at level 24, I had no hope of
actually killing them myself, I know they were high level. I wasn't
really ranting about not getting anything, I didn't really expect to,
I was ranting about the high levels finally getting organized, but
killing the pivotal NPCs. After the whole Innoruk and the opening of
the plane, it seemed like the NPCs were all put on autopilot so...I
guess I don't *really* understand what was going on, but it seemed
really disorganized and as if someone had killed an NPC they shouldn't
have and ruined what the GM's were trying to do. I guess if they
really don't want someone killed they make them invincible, but
whatever. I thought it was cool to be there for the plane opening.

Robynn, only 4 hours til I can go home and play

--
Katy Westerman Don't lick something unless
katyw@... you really mean it.
